chassisActiveIpAddr.name: chassisActiveIpAddr
chassisActiveIpAddr.description: Active IP Address for Management of this chassis. This is the IP address used for network mangement and will point to the active of the 2 NPs in a given chassis.

chassisSecondaryIpAddr.name: chassisSecondaryIpAddr
chassisSecondaryIpAddr.description: Secondary IP Address for Management of this chassis. This is the IP address used for network mangement and will point to the backup NP in a given chassis.

chassisNetworkMask.name: chassisNetworkMask
chassisNetworkMask.description: Subnet mask used for the IP addresses associated with switch ports

chassisEthernetIpAddr.name: chassisEthernetIpAddr
chassisEthernetIpAddr.description: This is the IP Address associated with the ethernet port on the primary NP in the chassis. The Ethernet port on the backup NP is unused,should that NP become primary it will take over the chassisEthernetIpAddr.

chassisEthernetIpMask.name: chassisEthernetIpMask
chassisEthernetIpMask.description: This is the IP network mask associated with the Ethernet to which the network processors in the chassis are connected.

chassisDefaultIpRouter.name: chassisDefaultIpRouter
chassisDefaultIpRouter.description: This is a machine, connected to the same ethernet as the chassis' NPs, which is capable of routing IP datagrams to other portions of the Internet.

chassisStatusWord.name: chassisStatusWord
chassisStatusWord.description: Bit map of certain chassis wide status information for use with UB Net/Director.

chassisConsoleTrapLevel.name: chassisConsoleTrapLevel
chassisConsoleTrapLevel.description: Trap level to use with console trap display

cardEntry.name: cardEntry
cardEntry.description: An entry in the chassis card table. (1-n)

cardIndex.name: cardIndex
cardIndex.description: Unique Index consisting of card number.

cardLcSoftwareVersion.name: cardLcSoftwareVersion
cardLcSoftwareVersion.description: Software revision of process running in the line card

cardLccSoftwareVersion.name: cardLccSoftwareVersion
cardLccSoftwareVersion.description: Software revision of process controlling card

cardPID.name: cardPID
cardPID.description: Unique Process ID for LCC process (from OS).

cardMaxVCs.name: cardMaxVCs
cardMaxVCs.description: Maximum Virtual Circuits Supported by this card

cardAdminStatus.name: cardAdminStatus
cardAdminStatus.description: Administratively Desired Status of this card

cardStatusWord.name: cardStatusWord
cardStatusWord.description: Card status word, for use with the UB Net/Director product

cardConfigRegister.name: cardConfigRegister
cardConfigRegister.description: Actual Card Enable Status as read from status register

portInfoEntry.name: portInfoEntry
portInfoEntry.description: An entry in the Edge Port table.

portInfoIndex.name: portInfoIndex
portInfoIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

portInfoType.name: portInfoType
portInfoType.description: Object id of the port information table used with this port. (e.g. ls1InfoTable for the low speed line card version 1

portInfoSpecific.name: portInfoSpecific
portInfoSpecific.description: Object id of the port information table used with this port. (e.g. ls1InfoTable for the low speed line card version 1

portInfoName.name: portInfoName
portInfoName.description: The name of this port. This is primary used as a help aid to identification. There is no absolute need for it to be set.

portInfoErrorLimit.name: portInfoErrorLimit
portInfoErrorLimit.description: The maximum error for this port, expressed as an inverse power of ten. I.E. 3 sets an acceptable error rate of 10**-3 receive+transmit errors. When this object is set to the value 0, the error limit trap is disabled. This value is always 0, i.e. disabled for Ethernet and FDDI ports.

ls1InfoTable.name: ls1InfoTable
ls1InfoTable.description: Edge Port Address table specific Information

ls1InfoEntry.name: ls1InfoEntry
ls1InfoEntry.description: An entry in the Edge Port Address table.

ls1InfoIfIndex.name: ls1InfoIfIndex
ls1InfoIfIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

ls1InfoType.name: ls1InfoType
ls1InfoType.description: Level 1 interface type used for this port

ls1InfoAdminCsuType.name: ls1InfoAdminCsuType
ls1InfoAdminCsuType.description: Identifier of administartively specified CSU Interface

ls1InfoOperNetIntType.name: ls1InfoOperNetIntType
ls1InfoOperNetIntType.description: Operational network Interface Type for this port: DCE, DTE, or DCE with local tt loopback. This last option provides the ability to interface to DTE devices which are unable to return the tt signal as required for full V.35 standard compliance.

ls1InfoAdminNetIntType.name: ls1InfoAdminNetIntType
ls1InfoAdminNetIntType.description: Administrative or desired Network Interface Type for DCE, DTE, or DCE with local tt loopback. This last option provides the ability to interface to DTE devices which are unable to return the tt signal as required for full V.35 standard compliance.

ls1InfoOperModemState.name: ls1InfoOperModemState
ls1InfoOperModemState.description: Operational Status of certain modem signals. A bitmask which gives the current state of certain modmem signals is returned. If the Port is configured as a DTE, bit 0 will be DCD and bit 1 DSR. If the Port is configured as a DCE, bit 0 will be RTS and bit 1 DTR.

ls1InfoOperProtocol.name: ls1InfoOperProtocol
ls1InfoOperProtocol.description: Operational higher level protocol stack to support on this port.

ls1InfoAdminProtocol.name: ls1InfoAdminProtocol
ls1InfoAdminProtocol.description: Administratively desired higher level protocol stack to support on this port.

ls1InfoOperControlBandwidthSize.name: ls1InfoOperControlBandwidthSize
ls1InfoOperControlBandwidthSize.description: The current operation value of the control bandwidth size for this port. This is a scaling factor. This value is multiplied by ls1InfoOperRcvBaudRate and the result divided by 1000 to derive the actual bandwidth.

ls1InfoAdminControlBandwidthSize.name: ls1InfoAdminControlBandwidthSize
ls1InfoAdminControlBandwidthSize.description: The current administratively desired value of the control bandwidth size for this port. Setting the trigger variable ls1InfoAdimOperTrigger will cause this value to become the operation value. This is a scaling factor. This value is multiplied by ls1InfoAdminRcvBaudRate and the result divided by 1000 to derive the actual bandwidth.

ls1InfoOperDataBandwidthSize.name: ls1InfoOperDataBandwidthSize
ls1InfoOperDataBandwidthSize.description: The current operation value of the data bandwidth size for this port. This is a scaling factor. This value is multiplied by ls1InfoOperRcvBaudRate and the result divided by 1000 to derive the actual bandwidth.

ls1InfoAdminDataBandwidthSize.name: ls1InfoAdminDataBandwidthSize
ls1InfoAdminDataBandwidthSize.description: The current administratively desired value of the data bandwidth size for this port. Setting the trigger variable ls1InfoAdimOperTrigger will cause this value to become the operation value. This is a scaling factor. This value is multiplied by ls1InfoAdminRcvBaudRate and the result divided by 1000 to derive the actual bandwidth.

ls1InfoOperLoopMode.name: ls1InfoOperLoopMode
ls1InfoOperLoopMode.description: Operational loop mode for this port: none, internal, external, or remote

ls1InfoAdminLoopMode.name: ls1InfoAdminLoopMode
ls1InfoAdminLoopMode.description: Administrative or desired loop mode for this port: none, internal, external, or remote

ls1InfoLcAutoEnable.name: ls1InfoLcAutoEnable
ls1InfoLcAutoEnable.description: State of the LC auto-enable flag for this port. If enabled the port will be enable at LC boot time. If disabled the port will remain disabled until configured and started by the LCC software on the NP. This parameter is set in the LC EEPROM by portctl.

ls1InfoLcDebugLevel.name: ls1InfoLcDebugLevel
ls1InfoLcDebugLevel.description: Value of the LC debug level variable for this port. This parameter is set in the LC EEPROM by portctl.

ls1InfoDataCellCapacity.name: ls1InfoDataCellCapacity
ls1InfoDataCellCapacity.description: The portion of this port's capacity in cells that is allocated for data traffic.

ls1InfoDataCellAvailable.name: ls1InfoDataCellAvailable
ls1InfoDataCellAvailable.description: The portion of this port's capacity in cells that is available for data traffic. This variable is adjusted for the bandwidth consumed by VCs created using this port. It does not count VCs which have been configured but not yet established.

ls1InfoMeasuredBaudRate.name: ls1InfoMeasuredBaudRate
ls1InfoMeasuredBaudRate.description: This is the line rate as measured from the line card.

ls1InfoLinkUtilization.name: ls1InfoLinkUtilization
ls1InfoLinkUtilization.description: This is an estimated utilization on the link.

ls1InfoAdminOperTrigger.name: ls1InfoAdminOperTrigger
ls1InfoAdminOperTrigger.description: When proper commands written to this variable the LCC attempts to change the state of the port such that the oper status reflects the desired admin status.

ms1InfoEntry.description: An entry in the Edge Port Address table.

ms1InfoAdminCableLength.name: ms1InfoAdminCableLength

ms1InfoAdminProtocol.description: Administratively desired higher level protocol stack to support on this port.

This value is multiplied by ms1InfoAdminRcvBaudRate and the result divided by 1000 to derive the actual bandwidth.

Setting the trigger variable ms1InfoAdimOperTrigger will cause this value to become the operation value. This is a scaling factor. ms1InfoLcAutoEnable.description: State of the LC auto-enable flag for this port. If enabled the port will be enable at LC boot time. If disabled the port will remain disabled until configured and started by the LCC software on the NP. This parameter is set in the LC EEPROM by portctl.

ms1InfoLcDebugLevel.name: ms1InfoLcDebugLevel
ms1InfoLcDebugLevel.description: Value of the LC debug level variable for this port. This parameter is set in the LC EEPROM by portctl.

ms1InfoOperScramble.name: ms1InfoOperScramble
ms1InfoOperScramble.description: Operational value for Cell Payload scrambling used for this port.

ms1InfoAdminScramble.name: ms1InfoAdminScramble
ms1InfoAdminScramble.description: Administrative value for Cell Payload scrambling used for this port. Setting the trigger variable ms1InfoAdimOperTrigger will cause this value to become the operation value.

ms1InfoDataCellCapacity.name: ms1InfoDataCellCapacity
ms1InfoDataCellCapacity.description: The portion of this port's capacity in cells that is allocated for data traffic.

ms1InfoDataCellAvailable.name: ms1InfoDataCellAvailable
ms1InfoDataCellAvailable.description: The portion of this port's capacity in cells that is available for data traffic. This variable is adjusted for the bandwidth consumed by VCs created using this port. It does not count VCs which have been configured but not yet established.

ms1InfoLinkUtilization.name: ms1InfoLinkUtilization
ms1InfoLinkUtilization.description: This is an estimated utilization on the link.

ms1InfoOperFraming.name: ms1InfoOperFraming
ms1InfoOperFraming.description: Operational ATM framing typein use on this port.

ms1InfoAdminOperTrigger.name: ms1InfoAdminOperTrigger
ms1InfoAdminOperTrigger.description: When proper commands written to this variable the LCC attempts to change the state of the port such that the oper status reflects the desired admin status.

npInfoIPCommittedBurst.description: Default committed burst rate for IP circuits

clc1InfoAdminLoopMode.description: Administrative or desired loop mode for this port: none, internal, or external.

clc1InfoLcAutoEnable.description: State of the LC auto-enable flag for this port. If enabled the port will be enable at LC boot time. If disabled the port will remain disabled until configured and started by the LCC software on the NP. This parameter is set in the LC EEPROM by portctl.

oc3InfoTable.name: oc3InfoTable
oc3InfoTable.description: Edge Port Address table specific Information

oc3InfoEntry.name: oc3InfoEntry
oc3InfoEntry.description: An entry in the Edge Port Address table.

oc3InfoReceiveSignalDetect.name: oc3InfoReceiveSignalDetect
oc3InfoReceiveSignalDetect.description: This value indicates that a receive signal has been detected on thei port

oc3InfoTransmitSafetySwitch.name: oc3InfoTransmitSafetySwitch
oc3InfoTransmitSafetySwitch.description: State of the Safety Switch with the single mode interface. When the saftey switch is enabled, the laser is disabled. This variable is undefined for multimode interfaces.

oc3InfoMediumType.name: oc3InfoMediumType
oc3InfoMediumType.description: This variable identifies whether a SONET or a SDH signal is used across this interface.

caMaxIntervalPermitLimit.name: caMaxIntervalPermitLimit
caMaxIntervalPermitLimit.description: The maximum interval at which permit limits are to be reported by trunk and outgoing edge cards.

caMinIntervalPermitLimit.name: caMinIntervalPermitLimit
caMinIntervalPermitLimit.description: The minimum interval at which permit limits are to be reported by trunk and outgoing edge cards.

caMinIntervalCaInfo.name: caMinIntervalCaInfo
caMinIntervalCaInfo.description: The minimum interval at which CA information processes are to distribute aggregated CA updates to input edge cards.

mmaDbActive.name: mmaDbActive
mmaDbActive.description: Controls and displays state of persistent database used by MMA. Primary use of this variable was to allow release 1 configuration systems to shut off the database before it was replaced with a new one and then re-activated. The release 2 configuration mechanism depends on mmaSetLock to backup and coordinate configuration updates.

mmaTrapFilter.name: mmaTrapFilter
mmaTrapFilter.description: Value of highest priority trap that will be be forwarded to any NMS sites. For example if set to mediumPriority then mediumPrioriy and highPriority messages will be forwarded

mmaTrapLanguage.name: mmaTrapLanguage
mmaTrapLanguage.description: Langauage to be used for the text of traps.

mmaCollectionSpace.name: mmaCollectionSpace
mmaCollectionSpace.description: Max size of disk space available for collecting autonomous traps. Actual size is mmaCollectionSpace * 1024

mmaConfigAuthor.name: mmaConfigAuthor
mmaConfigAuthor.description: Person who last changed configuration file

mmaConfigID.name: mmaConfigID
mmaConfigID.description: Configuration ID set by configuration program

mmaSetLock.name: mmaSetLock
mmaSetLock.description: If a user locks this field (2 or 3), set commands are accepted only from that IP address. The lock times out if the session is idle for two minutes. There are two configuration files: mma.db.pag and mma.db.dir. If set to lockPermanent(3), these files are copied to mma.db.BAK.pag and mma.db.BAK.dir, and sets are written to the configuration files. Otherwise sets are written to run-time memory only. To recover backup configuration files, the user must log in to the LightStream node and rename the files.

mmaTrapLog.name: mmaTrapLog
mmaTrapLog.description: Trap log control field. If enabled the MMA will log traps received from LWMA clients to disk. It saves traps into a 'circular file' such that only the last number of traps are on disk.

mmaTrapNumber.name: mmaTrapNumber
mmaTrapNumber.description: Trap Number used by the state and action variables

mmaTrapOnOffState.name: mmaTrapOnOffState
mmaTrapOnOffState.description: On/Off State of Trap specified in mmaTrapNumber and mmaTrapPidSelector

mmaNumNameEntry.name: mmaNumNameEntry
mmaNumNameEntry.description: An entry in the file transfer table.

mmaNumNameNumber.name: mmaNumNameNumber
mmaNumNameNumber.description: Unique Index consisting of chassis ID.

mmaNumName.name: mmaNumName
mmaNumName.description: Name of chassis corresponding to value of mmaNumNameNumber.

mmaLwmpTimeouts.name: mmaLwmpTimeouts
mmaLwmpTimeouts.description: The number of times the MMA did a read on a socket to a chassis-resident process and timed out before the process responded. This object is being added here for debug purposes and may be changed in future releases of the MIB.

collectEntry.name: collectEntry
collectEntry.description: An entry in the Collector collection table. (1-n)

collectIndex.name: collectIndex
collectIndex.description: Unique Index consisting of collection number.

collectStatus.name: collectStatus
collectStatus.description: Collection status of this collection row entry.

collectStart.name: collectStart
collectStart.description: Collection start time. If specified and status is valid means a collection will start at time. Time is the UNIX real time in seconds.

collectFinish.name: collectFinish
collectFinish.description: Collection finish time in TOD seconds.

collectFileName.name: collectFileName
collectFileName.description: Automatically generated filename for this collection. The file name is 'Collect.n' where 'n' is the collectIndex.

collectFileSize.name: collectFileSize
collectFileSize.description: Max Size of the circular file named in collectFileName. Actual maximum size of file is value of collectFileSize * 1024.

collectOperStatus.name: collectOperStatus
collectOperStatus.description: Collection status of this collection row entry.

collectDbEntry.name: collectDbEntry
collectDbEntry.description: An entry in the Collector group database. (1-n)

collectDBInstance.name: collectDBInstance
collectDBInstance.description: Record instance within a group ID

collectDBObjectID.name: collectDBObjectID
collectDBObjectID.description: Object identifier of a member of a group specified by the group ID and instance.

collectDBStatus.name: collectDBStatus
collectDBStatus.description: Collection status of this collection database row entry.

collectCommunityName.name: collectCommunityName
collectCommunityName.description: Used by Collector with its SNMP requests to the MMA.

rmonCommunityName.name: rmonCommunityName
rmonCommunityName.description: Used by RMON/Collector with its SNMP requests to the MMA.

edgePortTable.name: edgePortTable
edgePortTable.description: EdgePort Port Address table specific information

edgePortEntry.name: edgePortEntry
edgePortEntry.description: An entry in the EdgePort Port Address table.

edgeIfIndex.name: edgeIfIndex
edgeIfIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

edgeUpcType.name: edgeUpcType
edgeUpcType.description: Usage Parameter Control model type. This parameter selects the UPC model, which regulates the flow of data into the network.

edgeUserDataPerCell.name: edgeUserDataPerCell
edgeUserDataPerCell.description: User data bits per cell. This specifies the expected packing efficiency when frames are converted to cells. It does not affect the actual packing of data into cells but serves as an estimate on which bandwidth allocation and other connection related functions will be based.

edgeCellDelayVariance.name: edgeCellDelayVariance
edgeCellDelayVariance.description: Cell Delay Variance in microseconds. This is the typical variance in the delay added as a cell is processed by an switch

edgePrincipalScale.name: edgePrincipalScale
edgePrincipalScale.description: Principal bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the principal portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001

edgeSecondaryScale.name: edgeSecondaryScale
edgeSecondaryScale.description: Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001

edgeMeteringFactor.name: edgeMeteringFactor
edgeMeteringFactor.description: Scale factor for the metering time charge, a value (divided by 256) by which to increase the time or slow down metering of traffic into the network. A value of 256 would typically keep the metering rate close to the minimum allowable rate for the aggregate information rate for the group of circuits being metered.

edgeMeteringBurstSize.name: edgeMeteringBurstSize
edgeMeteringBurstSize.description: This is the minimum number of cells to burst at a time

edgeCallSetupRetry.name: edgeCallSetupRetry
edgeCallSetupRetry.description: This specifies the initial time to wait between successive failed attempts to establish a connection. This interval is in seconds. An incremental backoff algorithm may applied to this value. See Parameter edgeCallSetupBackoff.

edgeCallSetupBackoff.name: edgeCallSetupBackoff
edgeCallSetupBackoff.description: This specifies the maximum power of 2 to backoff in call setup retry attempts. For each retry up to this maxumim the retry timer will be adjusted by multipliing by 2**(n). The first retry will be multiplied by 2**0 or 1, the second by 2**1 or 2, and so on. The variable can range from 1 to 10.

edgeMaxFrameSize.name: edgeMaxFrameSize
edgeMaxFrameSize.description: This specifies the maximum frame size that can be transmitted on this edge port. The size is specified in bytes.

frProvMiTable.name: frProvMiTable
frProvMiTable.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Annex D
frProvMiTable.description: The Parameters for the Data Link Connection Management Interface for the frame relay service on this interface.

frProvMiEntry.name: frProvMiEntry
frProvMiEntry.description: The Parameters for a particular Data Link Con- nection Management Interface.

frProvMiIfIndex.name: frProvMiIfIndex
frProvMiIfIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

frProvMiState.name: frProvMiState
frProvMiState.description: This variable states which Data Link Connec- tion Management scheme is active (and by impli- cation, what DLCI it uses) on the Frame Relay interface.

frProvMiAddressLen.name: frProvMiAddressLen
frProvMiAddressLen.description: This variable states which address length in octets. In the case of Q922 format, the length indicates the entire length of the address in- cluding the control portion.

frProvMiNetRequestInterval.name: frProvMiNetRequestInterval
frProvMiNetRequestInterval.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.7 Timer T392.
frProvMiNetRequestInterval.description: This is the maximum number of seconds between successive status enquiry messages. If a status enquiry message does not arrive within this time an error event occurs. This is also refered to as T392 and nT2. Must be 5 in second intervals as defined in the ANSI and ITU specifications.

frProvMiNetErrorThreshold.name: frProvMiNetErrorThreshold
frProvMiNetErrorThreshold.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.5.1 Counter N392.
frProvMiNetErrorThreshold.description: This is the maximum number of unanswered Status Enquiries the equipment shall accept be- fore declaring the interface down by the network side of the interface. This is also refered to as N392 and nN2.

frProvMiNetMonitoredEvents.name: frProvMiNetMonitoredEvents
frProvMiNetMonitoredEvents.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.5.2 Counter N393.
frProvMiNetMonitoredEvents.description: This is the number of status polling intervals over which the error threshold is counted. For example, if within 'MonitoredEvents' number of events the station receives 'ErrorThreshold' number of errors, the interface is marked as down. This is also refered to as N393 and nN3.

frProvMiMaxSupportedVCs.name: frProvMiMaxSupportedVCs
frProvMiMaxSupportedVCs.description: The maximum number of Virtual Circuits allowed for this interface. Usually dictated by the Frame Relay network. This variable will limit the creation of more than this number of VCs. It will not delete VCs which have already been configured at the time this parameter is set. In response to a SET, if a value less than zero or higher than the agent's maximal capability is configured, the agent should respond bad- Value

frProvMiMulticast.name: frProvMiMulticast
frProvMiMulticast.description: This indicates whether the Frame Relay inter- face is using a multicast service.

frProvMiUserPollingInterval.name: frProvMiUserPollingInterval
frProvMiUserPollingInterval.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.7 Timer T391.
frProvMiUserPollingInterval.description: This is the number of seconds between succes- sive status enquiry messages sent by the user portion of a NNI interface. This is also refered to as T391 and nT1.

frProvMiUserFullEnquiryInterval.name: frProvMiUserFullEnquiryInterval
frProvMiUserFullEnquiryInterval.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.7 Counter N391.
frProvMiUserFullEnquiryInterval.description: Number of status enquiry intervals that pass before issuance of a full status enquiry mes- sage by the user portion of a NNI interface. This is also refered to as N391 and nN1.

frProvMiUserErrorThreshold.name: frProvMiUserErrorThreshold
frProvMiUserErrorThreshold.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.5.1 Counter N392.
frProvMiUserErrorThreshold.description: This is the maximum number of unanswered Status Enquiries the equipment shall accept be- fore declaring the interface down by the user side of the NNI interface. This is also refered to as N392 and nT2.

frProvMiUserMonitoredEvents.name: frProvMiUserMonitoredEvents
frProvMiUserMonitoredEvents.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section D.5.2 Counter N393.
frProvMiUserMonitoredEvents.description: This is the number of status polling intervals over which the error threshold is counted on a NNI interface. For example, if within 'MonitoredEvents' number of events the station receives 'ErrorThreshold' number of errors, the interface is marked as down.

frProvMiNetInterfaceType.name: frProvMiNetInterfaceType
frProvMiNetInterfaceType.description: This variable states which type of Network Interface should be used. UNI provides for a User Network Interface, while NNI provides for a Network to Network Interface.

frCktAdminSrcInsuredRate.name: frCktAdminSrcInsuredRate
frCktAdminSrcInsuredRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktAdminSrcInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from Source to Destination. It is specified in bits per second. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperSrcInsuredRate.name: frCktOperSrcInsuredRate
frCktOperSrcInsuredRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktOperSrcInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from source to destination. It is specified in bits per second.

frCktAdminSrcInsuredBurst.name: frCktAdminSrcInsuredBurst
frCktAdminSrcInsuredBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktAdminSrcInsuredBurst.description: This variable indicates the Insured Burst Size, which is the amount of insured data, in bytes, that the network agrees to transfer under normal conditions, during the measurement interval from source to destination. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperSrcInsuredBurst.name: frCktOperSrcInsuredBurst
frCktOperSrcInsuredBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktOperSrcInsuredBurst.description: This variable indicates the Insured Burst Size, which is the amount of insured data, in bytes, that the network agrees to transfer under normal conditions, during the measurement interval from source to destination.

frCktAdminSrcMaxRate.name: frCktAdminSrcMaxRate
frCktAdminSrcMaxRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktAdminSrcMaxRate.description: This variable, the Maximum Rate is the the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network agrees to support from source to destination. It is specified in bits per second. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperSrcMaxRate.name: frCktOperSrcMaxRate
frCktOperSrcMaxRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktOperSrcMaxRate.description: This variable, the Maximum Rate is the the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network agrees to support from source to destination. It is specified in bits per second.

frCktAdminSrcMaxBurst.name: frCktAdminSrcMaxBurst
frCktAdminSrcMaxBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktAdminSrcMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the Total Burst Size, which is the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data bytes that the network will at- tempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Source to the Destination. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperSrcMaxBurst.name: frCktOperSrcMaxBurst
frCktOperSrcMaxBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktOperSrcMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the Total Burst Size, which is the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data bytes that the network will at- tempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Source to the Destination.

frCktAdminDestInsuredRate.name: frCktAdminDestInsuredRate
frCktAdminDestInsuredRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktAdminDestInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from destination to source. It is specified in bits per second. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperDestInsuredRate.name: frCktOperDestInsuredRate
frCktOperDestInsuredRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktOperDestInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from destination to source. It is specified in bits per second.

frCktAdminDestInsuredBurst.name: frCktAdminDestInsuredBurst
frCktAdminDestInsuredBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19

frCktOperDestInsuredBurst.name: frCktOperDestInsuredBurst
frCktOperDestInsuredBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19

frCktAdminDestMaxRate.name: frCktAdminDestMaxRate

frCktOperDestMaxRate.name: frCktOperDestMaxRate
frCktOperDestMaxRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
frCktOperDestMaxRate.description: This variable, the maximum rate is the total data throughput that the network will allow to pass on this VC under optimal network conditions from destination to source. It is specified in bits per second.

frCktAdminDestMaxBurst.name: frCktAdminDestMaxBurst
frCktAdminDestMaxBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktAdminDestMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the Total Burst Size, which is the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data bytes that the network will at- tempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Destination to the Source. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperDestMaxBurst.name: frCktOperDestMaxBurst
frCktOperDestMaxBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
frCktOperDestMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the Total Burst Size, which is the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data bytes that the network will at- tempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Destination to the Source.

frCktOperSecondaryScale.name: frCktOperSecondaryScale
frCktOperSecondaryScale.description: Operational version of the Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001 254 (reserved) 255 (per-port dflt)

frCktAdminSecondaryScale.name: frCktAdminSecondaryScale
frCktAdminSecondaryScale.description: Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001 254 (reserved) 255 (per-port dflt)

frCktOperPrinBwType.name: frCktOperPrinBwType
frCktOperPrinBwType.description: This variable indicates the type of service supported on primary portion of this Virtual Circuit.

frCktAdminPrinBwType.name: frCktAdminPrinBwType
frCktAdminPrinBwType.description: This variable indicates the type of service supported on primary portion of this Virtual Circuit. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperTransPri.name: frCktOperTransPri
frCktOperTransPri.description: This variable indicates the transfer priority supported on this Virtual Circuit.

frCktAdminTransPri.name: frCktAdminTransPri
frCktAdminTransPri.description: This variable indicates the transfer priority supported on this Virtual Circuit. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktOperUserDataPerCell.name: frCktOperUserDataPerCell
frCktOperUserDataPerCell.description: Operational User data bits per cell, specifies the expected packing efficiency when frames are converted to cells. It does not affect the actual packing of data into cells but serves as an estimate on which bandwidth allocation and other connection related functions will be based.

frCktAdminUserDataPerCell.name: frCktAdminUserDataPerCell
frCktAdminUserDataPerCell.description: Administrative User data bits per cell, specifies the expected packing efficiency when frames are converted to cells. It does not affect the actual packing of data into cells but serves as an estimate on which bandwidth allocation and other connection related functions will be based. This variable takes effect when frCktStatus is set.

frCktStatus.name: frCktStatus
frCktStatus.description: This variable indicates the Status of this Virtual Circuit. It may be enabled or disabled. In order to modify a Virtual Circuit, the new desired variables should be modified and then this variable should be set (or set again) to enabled. At that time desired variables will become the actual variables. To remove a PVC, set its status to delete. By default, if not configured when creating the entry, the status is disabled.

frCktInfoRmtLMI.description: This variable indicates the remote LMI state of the circuit.

frCktInfoCallIDIncoming.name: frCktInfoCallIDIncoming
frCktInfoCallIDIncoming.description: This variable indicates the Call Identifier assigned to the incomming half of this circuit.

frCktInfoCallIDOutgoing.name: frCktInfoCallIDOutgoing
frCktInfoCallIDOutgoing.description: This variable indicates the Call Identifier assigned to the outgoing half of this circuit.

frCktInfoDownstreamState.name: frCktInfoDownstreamState
frCktInfoDownstreamState.description: This variable indicates the state of the downstream half of the circuit. (passing data from the local port to the remote end of the network)

frCktInfoUpstreamState.name: frCktInfoUpstreamState
frCktInfoUpstreamState.description: This variable indicates the state of the upstream half of the circuit. (passing data from the port at the remote end of the network to the local port)

frCktInfoLastAtmErr.name: frCktInfoLastAtmErr
frCktInfoLastAtmErr.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow.

frCktInfoDataCellsRequired.name: frCktInfoDataCellsRequired
frCktInfoDataCellsRequired.description: This variable indicates the bandwidth in cells needed to establish this VC. The value returned combines the committed and the Secondary bandwidth needs.

frCktInfoLastAtmLocation.name: frCktInfoLastAtmLocation
frCktInfoLastAtmLocation.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow. The format of the string is: nodenum:ifIndex where all numbers are specified in decimal. For example 5142:6000 refers to the remote endpoint with node 5142, ifIndex 6000 (slot 6 port 0 fr type 0).

sUniCktAdminSrcMaxRate.description: This variable, the maximum rate is the the total amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network attempts to support under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperSrcMaxRate.name: sUniCktOperSrcMaxRate
sUniCktOperSrcMaxRate.description: This variable, the maximum rate is the the total amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network attempts to support under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second.

sUniCktAdminSrcMaxBurst.name: sUniCktAdminSrcMaxBurst
sUniCktAdminSrcMaxBurst.description: This variable is the maximum Burst Size, the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data, in cells, that the network will attempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Source to the Destination. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperSrcMaxBurst.name: sUniCktOperSrcMaxBurst
sUniCktOperSrcMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the maximum Burst Size, the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured cells, that the network will attempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Source to the Destination.

sUniCktAdminDestInsuredRate.name: sUniCktAdminDestInsuredRate
sUniCktAdminDestInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperDestInsuredRate.name: sUniCktOperDestInsuredRate
sUniCktOperDestInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate, is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second.

sUniCktAdminDestInsuredBurst.name: sUniCktAdminDestInsuredBurst
sUniCktAdminDestInsuredBurst.description: This variable indicates the Insured Burst Size, which is the amount of insured data, in cells, that the network agrees to transfer under normal conditions, during the measurement interval from destination to source. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperDestInsuredBurst.name: sUniCktOperDestInsuredBurst
sUniCktOperDestInsuredBurst.description: This variable indicates the Insured Burst Size, which is the amount of insured data, in cells, that the network agrees to transfer under normal conditions, during the measurement interval from destination to source.

sUniCktAdminDestMaxRate.name: sUniCktAdminDestMaxRate
sUniCktAdminDestMaxRate.description: This variable, the maximum rate is the the total amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network attempts to support under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperDestMaxRate.name: sUniCktOperDestMaxRate
sUniCktOperDestMaxRate.description: This variable, the maximum rate is the the total amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network attempts to support under normal network conditions from destination to source. This is specified in cells per second.

sUniCktAdminDestMaxBurst.name: sUniCktAdminDestMaxBurst
sUniCktAdminDestMaxBurst.description: This variable is the maximum Burst Size, the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured cells that the network will attempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Destination to the Source. This variable takes effect when sUniCktSts is set.

sUniCktOperDestMaxBurst.name: sUniCktOperDestMaxBurst
sUniCktOperDestMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the maximum Burst Size, the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured cells that the network will attempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Destination to the Source.

sUniCktAdminSecondaryScale.name: sUniCktAdminSecondaryScale
sUniCktAdminSecondaryScale.description: Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001 254 (reserved) 255 (per-port dflt)

sUniCktOperSecondaryScale.name: sUniCktOperSecondaryScale
sUniCktOperSecondaryScale.description: Operational version of the Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001 254 (reserved) 255 (per-port dflt)

sUniCktSts.name: sUniCktSts
sUniCktSts.description: This variable indicates the Status of this Virtual Circuit. It may be enabled or disabled. In order to modify a Virtual Circuit, the new desired variables should be modified and then this variable should be set (or set again) to enabled. At that time desired variables will become the actual variables. To remove a PVC, set its status to delete. By default, if not configured when creating the entry, the status is disabled.

sUniCktInfoIfIndex.description: The ifIndex Value of the ifEntry this virtual circuit is layered onto. See above comments to calculate ifIndex.

sUniCktInfoNetToUniCallID.name: sUniCktInfoNetToUniCallID

sUniCktInfoUniToNetState.name: sUniCktInfoUniToNetState
sUniCktInfoUniToNetState.description: This variable indicates the state of the UniToNet half of the circuit. (passing data from the local port to the remote end of the network)

sUniCktInfoNetToUniState.name: sUniCktInfoNetToUniState
sUniCktInfoNetToUniState.description: This variable indicates the state of the NetToUni half of the circuit. (passing data from the port at the remote end of the network to the local port)

sUniCktInfoLastAtmErr.name: sUniCktInfoLastAtmErr
sUniCktInfoLastAtmErr.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow.

sUniCktInfoDataCellsRequired.name: sUniCktInfoDataCellsRequired
sUniCktInfoDataCellsRequired.description: This variable indicates the bandwidth in cells needed to establish this VC. The value returned combines the committed and the Secondary bandwidth needs.

sUniCktInfoLastAtmLocation.name: sUniCktInfoLastAtmLocation
sUniCktInfoLastAtmLocation.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow. The format of the string is: nodenum:ifIndex where all numbers are specified in decimal. For example 5142:6000 refers to the remote endpoint with node 5142, ifIndex 6000 (slot 6 port 0 frType 0).

pvcCfgTable.description: A table containing information about specific PVCs.

pvcEntry.name: pvcEntry
pvcEntry.description: The information regarding a single PVC.

pvcSrcIfIndex.name: pvcSrcIfIndex
pvcSrcIfIndex.description: The ifIndex Value of the ifEntry this virtual circuit is layered onto. See above comments to calculate ifIndex.

pvcSrcPvcId.name: pvcSrcPvcId
pvcSrcPvcId.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.618-1991, Section 3.3.6
pvcSrcPvcId.description: The local PVC Connection Identifier for this virtual circuit.

pvcSrcNode.name: pvcSrcNode
pvcSrcNode.description: The Node Identifier for the source end of this virtual circuit.

pvcSrcInsuredRate.name: pvcSrcInsuredRate

pvcSrcInsuredRate.description: This variable, the Insured Rate is the rate of insured data that the network commits to supporting under normal network conditions from Source to Destination. It is specified in bits per second. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcSrcInsuredBurst.name: pvcSrcInsuredBurst
pvcSrcInsuredBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
pvcSrcInsuredBurst.description: This variable indicates the Insured Burst Size, which is the amount of insured data, in bytes, that the network agrees to transfer under normal conditions, during the measurement interval from source to destination. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcSrcMaxRate.name: pvcSrcMaxRate
pvcSrcMaxRate.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19 Throughput parameter
pvcSrcMaxRate.description: This variable, the Maximum Rate is the the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data throughput that the network agrees to support from source to destination. It is specified in bits per second. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcSrcMaxBurst.name: pvcSrcMaxBurst
pvcSrcMaxBurst.reference: Draft American National Standard T1.617-1991, Section 6.5.19
pvcSrcMaxBurst.description: This variable indicates the Total Burst Size, which is the maximum amount of insured plus uninsured data bytes that the network will at- tempt to deliver over the measurement interval from the Source to the Destination. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcSecondaryScale.name: pvcSecondaryScale
pvcSecondaryScale.description: Secondary bandwidth scaling factor. This is used to scale down the actual amount of bandwidth to allocate for the Secondary portion of a VC's bandwidth. This is specified as a codepoint as follows: Codepoints Meaning Comment - ---------- ------- ------- 0 - 100 x / 100 e.g., 1 => .01 101 - 109 x - 100 / 1000 e.g., 101 => .001 254 (reserved) 255 (per-port dflt)

pvcPrinBwType.name: pvcPrinBwType
pvcPrinBwType.description: This variable indicates the type of service supported on primary portion of this Virtual Circuit. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcTransPri.name: pvcTransPri
pvcTransPri.description: This variable indicates the transfer priority supported on this Virtual Circuit. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcUserDataPerCell.name: pvcUserDataPerCell
pvcUserDataPerCell.description: User data bits per cell, specifies the expected packing efficiency when frames are converted to cells. It does not affect the actual packing of data into cells but serves as an estimate on which bandwidth allocation and other connection related functions will be based. This variable takes effect when pvcStatus is set. This variable may not be modified unless pvcStatus is set to disabled.

pvcStatus.name: pvcStatus
pvcStatus.description: This variable indicates the Status of this Virtual Circuit. It may be enabled or disabled. In order to modify a Virtual Circuit, the new desired variables should be modified and then this variable should be set (or set again) to enabled. At that time desired variables will become the actual variables. To remove a PVC, set its status to delete. By default, if not configured when creating the entry, the status is disabled.

mcEndptCfgTable.name: mcEndptCfgTable
mcEndptCfgTable.description: A table containing information about specific endpoints and corresponding circuits.

mcEndptEntry.name: mcEndptEntry
mcEndptEntry.description: The information regarding a single endpoint.

mcEndptLclIfIndex.name: mcEndptLclIfIndex
mcEndptLclIfIndex.description: The ifIndex Value of the ifEntry this virtual circuit is layered onto. See above comments to calculate ifIndex.

mcEndptLclCktid.name: mcEndptLclCktid
mcEndptLclCktid.description: The Local Circuit Identifier for this virtual circuit.

mcEndptLclInstance.name: mcEndptLclInstance
mcEndptLclInstance.description: A Locally significant index used to separate the different remote endpoints for this multicast virtual circuit.

mcEndptDest.description: The Destination for this segment of the multicast virtual circuit. The format of the string is: nodenum:ifIndex:cktID where all numbers are specified in decimal. For example 5142:6000:16 refers to the remote endpoint with node 5142, ifIndex 6000 (slot 6 port 0 frType 0), and circuit identifier 16. This variable cannot be modified while mcEndptStatus is set to active.

mcEndptServiceType.name: mcEndptServiceType
mcEndptServiceType.description: This variable is provided for future expansion, to allow creation of VCs between dissimilar protocols. This variable cannot be modified while mcEndptStatus is set to active.

mcEndptRmtVCstatus.name: mcEndptRmtVCstatus

mcEndptCallIDIncoming.name: mcEndptCallIDIncoming
mcEndptCallIDIncoming.description: This variable indicates the Call Identifier assigned to the incomming (from the net) direction of this circuit.

mcEndptDownstreamState.name: mcEndptDownstreamState
mcEndptDownstreamState.description: This variable indicates the state of the downstream direction of the circuit. (passing data from the local port to the remote end of the network)

mcEndptUpstreamState.name: mcEndptUpstreamState
mcEndptUpstreamState.description: This variable indicates the state of the upstream direction of the circuit. (passing data from the port at the remote end of the network to the local port)

mcEndptLastAtmErr.name: mcEndptLastAtmErr
mcEndptLastAtmErr.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow.

mcEndptLastAtmLocation.name: mcEndptLastAtmLocation
mcEndptLastAtmLocation.description: This variable indicates the last error, if any, returned by the Atm Connection Management layer when an attempt was made to create a connection or flow. The format of the string is: nodenum:ifIndex where all numbers are specified in decimal. For example 5142:6000 refers to the remote endpoint with node 5142, ifIndex 6000 (slot 6 port 0 frType 0).

mcEndptStatus.name: mcEndptStatus
mcEndptStatus.description: This variable indicates the Status of this Virtual Circuit. It may be enabled or disabled. In order to modify a Virtual Circuit, the new desired variables should be modified and then this variable should be set (or set again) to enabled. At that time desired variables will become the operational (or in-use) variables. To remove a PVC, set its status to delete. By default, if not configured when creating the entry, the status is disabled. An existing instance of this object cannot be set to createRequest(4). This object may only be set to createRequest(4) when this instance is created. When this object is created, the agent may wish to create supplemental object instances to complete a conceptual row in this table. Immediately after completing the create operation, the agent must set this object to underCreation(5). Entries shall exist in the underCreation(5) state until the management station is finished configuring the entry and sets this object to active(1), inactive(2), or aborts, setting this object to delete(4). If the agent determines that an entry has been in the underCreation(5) state for an abnormally long time, it may decide that the management station has become unavailable. If the agent makes this decision, it may set this object to delete(3) to reclaim the entry. A prudent agent will understand that the management station may need to wait for human input and will allow for that possibility in its determination of this abnormally long period.
