lsTrunkPortStatTable.description: Trunk Card specific statistics subset information

lsTrunkPortStatEntry.name: lsTrunkPortStatEntry
lsTrunkPortStatEntry.description: An entry in Trunk Port Statistics Table.

trunkPortStatIndex.name: trunkPortStatIndex
trunkPortStatIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

trunkPortRcvCells.name: trunkPortRcvCells
trunkPortRcvCells.description: Number of cells received regardless of error status

trunkPortXmtCells.name: trunkPortXmtCells
trunkPortXmtCells.description: Number of cells transmitted regardless of error status

trunkPortRcvRuns.name: trunkPortRcvRuns
trunkPortRcvRuns.description: The number of runs of cells received. A Run is a sequence of Non-Null Cells bounded by Null Cells.

trunkPortDownXmtCells.name: trunkPortDownXmtCells
trunkPortDownXmtCells.description: The number of cells received by the TSU for which the the VCI was not configured.

trunkPortRcvCRCErrors.name: trunkPortRcvCRCErrors
trunkPortRcvCRCErrors.description: The number of messages received by the port with CRC errors.

trunkPortRcvAborts.name: trunkPortRcvAborts
trunkPortRcvAborts.description: The number of aborts detected by the HW.

trunkPortXmtUnderflows.name: trunkPortXmtUnderflows
trunkPortXmtUnderflows.description: The number of underflow events detected by I/O hardware.

trunkPortRcvShortFrames.name: trunkPortRcvShortFrames
trunkPortRcvShortFrames.description: The number of short incoming frames detected by L2

lsTrunkCpuWorkloadTable.name: lsTrunkCpuWorkloadTable
lsTrunkCpuWorkloadTable.description: Trunk Card Workload Statistics Counter Table

lsTrunkCpuWorkloadEntry.name: lsTrunkCpuWorkloadEntry
lsTrunkCpuWorkloadEntry.description: An entry in the Trunk Cpu Workload Table

lsTrunkWorkloadCardIndex.name: lsTrunkWorkloadCardIndex
lsTrunkWorkloadCardIndex.description: Unique Trunk card Index consisting of card's slot number

lsTrunkWorkloadTypeIndex.name: lsTrunkWorkloadTypeIndex
lsTrunkWorkloadTypeIndex.description: Trunk CPU Workload Counter Variable: 1 - average workload

lsTrunkWorkloadEvents.name: lsTrunkWorkloadEvents
lsTrunkWorkloadEvents.description: Trunk Cpu Workload Counter for the specified Workload Variable

lcStatTable.name: lcStatTable
lcStatTable.description: Table of objects, such as FSU and TSU objects, which exist across for either trunk or edge cards, indexed by the line card alone. Some of these objects may require ASIC HW.

lcStatEntry.name: lcStatEntry
lcStatEntry.description: An entry in the LC common FSU Stat table.

tsuFreeCells.name: tsuFreeCells
tsuFreeCells.description: The total number of free cells available on the Tsu

fsuSharedFreeCells.name: fsuSharedFreeCells
fsuSharedFreeCells.description: Number of Cells on the shared free-list in the FSU.

tsuCellDropLastVci.name: tsuCellDropLastVci
tsuCellDropLastVci.description: The last VCI index associated with a message dropped by the TSU due to buffer shortage. This index implicitly determines the port and connection.

switchCellDgRejectEvents.name: switchCellDgRejectEvents
switchCellDgRejectEvents.description: The number of switch rejects of datagram cells. These are not errors, but this does provide a measure of switch contention. May only be available on ASIC HW Line Cards.

switchCellSchedRejectEvents.name: switchCellSchedRejectEvents
switchCellSchedRejectEvents.description: The number of switch rejects of datagram cells. These are errors, since appropriate scheduling should not allow these. May only be available on ASIC HW Line Cards.

tsuErrFutQCellDrops.name: tsuErrFutQCellDrops
tsuErrFutQCellDrops.description: The number of cells dropped due to FutureQ Overruns

tsuErrFutQMsgDropLastVci.name: tsuErrFutQMsgDropLastVci
tsuErrFutQMsgDropLastVci.description: The last Vci index associated with a cell dropped due to FutureQ overrun.

fsuHdrLrcErrs.name: fsuHdrLrcErrs
fsuHdrLrcErrs.description: The total number of LRC errors detected by the FSU

fsuPayloadLrcErrs.name: fsuPayloadLrcErrs
fsuPayloadLrcErrs.description: The total number of LRC errors detected by the FSU

lcPortStatTable.name: lcPortStatTable
lcPortStatTable.description: Table of Line Card (Edge and Trunk) Statistics by port. There are a number of TSU and FSU statistics in common to edges and trunks. Some of the objects in this table may be limited in use to ASIC HW.

lcPortStatEntry.name: lcPortStatEntry
lcPortStatEntry.description: An entry in the Line Card Stat Table, indexed by port.

lcStatPortIndex.name: lcStatPortIndex
lcStatPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

fsuPortFreeCells.name: fsuPortFreeCells
fsuPortFreeCells.description: Number of Cells on per-port FSU free lists.

fsuCellDropLastCellHdr.name: fsuCellDropLastCellHdr
fsuCellDropLastCellHdr.description: The last Cell Header associated with a FSU cell drop due to buffer shortage. Provides a clue as to which VCIs are being dropped. Since this is a full 32-bit header, the CLP bit state is available. The XCLP and Queue can be inferred from indirect lookup based on the header, if desired.

tsuPortErrL1UnconfigVcis.name: tsuPortErrL1UnconfigVcis
tsuPortErrL1UnconfigVcis.description: The number of cells received by the TSU for which the the VCI was not configured within the Level 1 table. Cells for unconfigured VCIs are dropped.

tsuPortErrL2UnconfigVcis.name: tsuPortErrL2UnconfigVcis
tsuPortErrL2UnconfigVcis.description: The number of cells received by the TSU for which the the VCI was not configured within the Level 2 table. Cells for unconfigured VCIs are dropped.

tsuPortErrL1UnconfigLastVci.name: tsuPortErrL1UnconfigLastVci
tsuPortErrL1UnconfigLastVci.description: The last 4-byte cell header associated with a Level 1 unconfigured VCI.

tsuPortErrL2UnconfigLastVci.name: tsuPortErrL2UnconfigLastVci
tsuPortErrL2UnconfigLastVci.description: The last 4-byte cell header associated with a Level 2 unconfigured VCI.

tsuPortErrNonZeroGfc.name: tsuPortErrNonZeroGfc
tsuPortErrNonZeroGfc.description: For a UNI, the number of cells received with a non-zero GFC byte. No action taken aside from counting.

fsuPortXmtCellsTable.name: fsuPortXmtCellsTable
fsuPortXmtCellsTable.description: Table of cells transmited by FSU to either a line-card chip or TLU, indexed by port and a drop priority subindex which represents the CLP and XCLP status of the cells. The priority index is tentatively defined as 2*CLP + XCLP + 1. Does not count cells dropped due to FSU buffer shortages or header LRC errors. Availability may depend on HW.

fsuPortXmtCellsEntry.name: fsuPortXmtCellsEntry
fsuPortXmtCellsEntry.description: An entry in the LC common FSU Port Xmt Cells Table.

fsuXmtCellsPortIndex.name: fsuXmtCellsPortIndex
fsuXmtCellsPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

fsuXmtCellsPriorityIndex.name: fsuXmtCellsPriorityIndex
fsuXmtCellsPriorityIndex.description: Index specifying the CLP and XCLP priority substream for the port. Index defined as 2*CLP + XCLP + 1.

fsuXmtCellEvents.name: fsuXmtCellEvents
fsuXmtCellEvents.description: Number of cells forwarded by the FSU towards the port indicated by the PortIndex, by the specified priority.

fsuQueueCellLengthTable.name: fsuQueueCellLengthTable
fsuQueueCellLengthTable.description: Table of current queue lengths by port and subqueue as measured in cells.

fsuQueueCellLenEntry.name: fsuQueueCellLenEntry
fsuQueueCellLenEntry.description: An entry in the FSU queue length table

fsuQueueCellLenPortIndex.name: fsuQueueCellLenPortIndex
fsuQueueCellLenPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

fsuQueueCellLenSubQIndex.name: fsuQueueCellLenSubQIndex
fsuQueueCellLenSubQIndex.description: Index specifying the subqueue for the port, where a lower queue number has a lower fsu priority.

fsuQueueCellLength.name: fsuQueueCellLength
fsuQueueCellLength.description: Length of the specified queue in cell units. For ASIC Edge versions, this will include cells on the reassembly Queue for a port. For non-ASIC Edge versions, does not include reassembly Queue. Non-ASIC versions provide an estimate due to slow-side scanner logic, while ASIC versions provide direct counts.

fsuDropEventTable.name: fsuDropEventTable
fsuDropEventTable.description: Table of drop events by FSU due to buffer shortage, by Port and drop watermark. This table may be limited in use to ASIC HW. For ASIC these are cell drops. For non-ASIC, might be messages instead of cells.

fsuDropEventEntry.name: fsuDropEventEntry
fsuDropEventEntry.description: An entry in the FSU Port/Watermark drop event table

fsuDropEventPortIndex.name: fsuDropEventPortIndex
fsuDropEventPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

fsuDropEventWatermarkIndex.name: fsuDropEventWatermarkIndex
fsuDropEventWatermarkIndex.description: Watermark associated with the drop count. The watermark selected is a function of the Fsu Priority, CLP and XCLP within port. We tentively define it to be (FSU-Priority)*4 + 2*CLP + XCLP+1. CLP and XCLP are 0/1 valued. At this time, there are eight Fsu priorities (treated as 0-7 in increasing priority), however these components cannot vary independently as currently used. Therefore, some entries will either not exist or will have a non-varying (default) count of zero.

fsuDropEvents.name: fsuDropEvents
fsuDropEvents.description: Count of the number drop events (cells or messages) dropped by the FSU due to low buffers, for the specified port and drop watermark.

lsFsuFastDropTable.name: lsFsuFastDropTable
lsFsuFastDropTable.description: Table of cells dropped by FSU due to buffer shortage, by drop watermark, for cards using the fast-side drop mechanism. These statistics are not available for other cards.

lsFsuFastDropEntry.name: lsFsuFastDropEntry
lsFsuFastDropEntry.description: An entry in the FSU fast-side per watermark drop table

lsFsuFastDropWatermarkIndex.name: lsFsuFastDropWatermarkIndex
lsFsuFastDropWatermarkIndex.description: Watermark used for dropping with the fast-drop mechanism.

lsFsuFastCellDropEvents.name: lsFsuFastCellDropEvents
lsFsuFastCellDropEvents.description: Count of the number cells dropped by FSU due to low buffers, for the specified watermark, using the fast-drop mechanism. These should be rare if the slow-side mechanism is functioning properly.

tsuDropEventTable.name: tsuDropEventTable
tsuDropEventTable.description: Table of drop events by TSU due to buffer shortage, by Port and drop watermark. A drop event corresponds to a cell drop for ASIC cards. It may correspond to frame drops` on other cards.

tsuDropEventEntry.name: tsuDropEventEntry
tsuDropEventEntry.description: An entry in the Edge Port/Watermark TSU drop events table

tsuDropEventPortIndex.name: tsuDropEventPortIndex
tsuDropEventPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

tsuDropEventWatermarkIndex.name: tsuDropEventWatermarkIndex
tsuDropEventWatermarkIndex.description: Watermark associated with the drop count.

tsuDropEvents.name: tsuDropEvents
tsuDropEvents.description: TSU drop events due to low buffers, for the specified port and drop watermark. For ASIC cards these are cell drops. For other cards the unit may be messages, depending on the card. These drops should be rare. They could be a byproduct of incorrect scheduled service setup.

lsLcFsuIntervalTable.name: lsLcFsuIntervalTable
lsLcFsuIntervalTable.description: Table of sampled FSU queue depths and drop information, by outbound port (trunk and edge) where sampling occurs for queue depth is sampled once per second and data is aggregated into one minute buckets defined by the lsLcIntervalNumber.

lsLcFsuIntervalEntry.name: lsLcFsuIntervalEntry
lsLcFsuIntervalEntry.description: An entry in the LC FSU Interval table

lsLcIntervalPortIndex.name: lsLcIntervalPortIndex
lsLcIntervalPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above. The port may be logical (e.g. terminated by a processor).

lsLcIntervalNumber.name: lsLcIntervalNumber
lsLcIntervalNumber.description: A number between 1 and 60, where 1 is the most recently completed 1 minute interval and 60 is the least recently completed one minute interval (assuming that all 60 intervals are valid). Currently only interval of 1 is supported

lsLcIntervalPSDepth.name: lsLcIntervalPSDepth
lsLcIntervalPSDepth.description: Peak sampled queue depth for this outbound port, in cells, where queue depth is sampled once per second.

lsLcIntervalASDepth.name: lsLcIntervalASDepth
lsLcIntervalASDepth.description: Average sampled queue depth for this outbound port, in cells, where queue depth is sampled once per second.

lsLcIntervalDropEvents.name: lsLcIntervalDropEvents
lsLcIntervalDropEvents.description: The Number of cell drop events encountered for this port during the specified interval. This provides the average cell loss ratio over the interval.

lsLcIntervalAvgCells.name: lsLcIntervalAvgCells
lsLcIntervalAvgCells.description: The Number of cells transmitted for this port during the specified interval. This provides average utilization over the interval.

lsLcIntervalPeakCells.name: lsLcIntervalPeakCells
lsLcIntervalPeakCells.description: The Peak Number of cells transmitted for this port during any one second measurement period within the specified interval. This provides peak one-second utilization information.

lsLcIntervalMinPermits.name: lsLcIntervalMinPermits
lsLcIntervalMinPermits.description: The Minimum Permit value as sampled once per second during the specified interval.

lsLcIntervalAvgPermits.name: lsLcIntervalAvgPermits
lsLcIntervalAvgPermits.description: The Average Permit value as sampled once per second during the specified interval.

lsLcIntervalMaxPermits.name: lsLcIntervalMaxPermits
lsLcIntervalMaxPermits.description: The Maximum Permit value as sampled once per second during the specified interval.

lsLcIntervalDecrPermits.name: lsLcIntervalDecrPermits
lsLcIntervalDecrPermits.description: The Number of Permit decrease updates submitted during the current interval

lsLcIntervalIncrPermits.name: lsLcIntervalIncrPermits
lsLcIntervalIncrPermits.description: The Number of Permit increase updates submitted during the current interval

lsLcIntervalMinBwAlloc.name: lsLcIntervalMinBwAlloc
lsLcIntervalMinBwAlloc.description: The minimum BW allocation assessed during the current interval.

lsLcIntervalAvgBwAlloc.name: lsLcIntervalAvgBwAlloc
lsLcIntervalAvgBwAlloc.description: The minimum BW allocation assessed during the current interval.

lsLcIntervalMaxBwAlloc.name: lsLcIntervalMaxBwAlloc
lsLcIntervalMaxBwAlloc.description: The maximum BW allocation assessed during the current interval.

lsNpCpuWorkloadTable.name: lsNpCpuWorkloadTable
lsNpCpuWorkloadTable.description: Network processor CPU specific workload statistics

lsNpCpuWorkloadEntry.name: lsNpCpuWorkloadEntry
lsNpCpuWorkloadEntry.description: An entry in the Network Processor Statistics table.

lsCellVciStatTable.name: lsCellVciStatTable
lsCellVciStatTable.description: Cell Port/VCI specific statistics subset information

lsCellVciStatEntry.name: lsCellVciStatEntry
lsCellVciStatEntry.description: An entry in the cell Port/Vci Statistics Table.

cellVciStatPortIndex.name: cellVciStatPortIndex
cellVciStatPortIndex.description: This is the ifIndex value of the corresponding ifEntry. See comments above.

cellVciStatVciIndex.name: cellVciStatVciIndex
cellVciStatVciIndex.description: Unique Vci identifier for indicated VC

cellVciToSwCLP0Cells.name: cellVciToSwCLP0Cells
cellVciToSwCLP0Cells.description: Number of Cells forwarded to TSU with CLP=0

cellVciToSwCLP01Cells.name: cellVciToSwCLP01Cells
cellVciToSwCLP01Cells.description: Number of Cells forwarded to TSU with CLP=1, which arrived at port as CLP=0.

cellVciToSwCLP1Cells.name: cellVciToSwCLP1Cells
cellVciToSwCLP1Cells.description: Number of Cells forwarded to TSU with CLP=1

cellVciToSwDiscardCells.name: cellVciToSwDiscardCells
cellVciToSwDiscardCells.description: Number of to-switch Cells discarded due to excessive traffic according to the Usage Parameter Descriptor for this Vci

irRoutingPathsGenerated.name: irRoutingPathsGenerated
irRoutingPathsGenerated.description: The number of path generation operations performed since initialization.

irRoutingPathGenSuccess.name: irRoutingPathGenSuccess
irRoutingPathGenSuccess.description: The number of path generation operations successfully performed since initialization.

irRoutingPathGenFailedNoResources.name: irRoutingPathGenFailedNoResources
irRoutingPathGenFailedNoResources.description: The number of path generation operations which have failed due to lack of network resources.

irRoutingPathGenFailedUnknown.name: irRoutingPathGenFailedUnknown
irRoutingPathGenFailedUnknown.description: The number of path generation operations which have failed because a specified port or chassis was unknown.

irRoutingPathGenFailedOther.name: irRoutingPathGenFailedOther
irRoutingPathGenFailedOther.description: The number of path generation operations which have failed for reasons other than unknown chassis/port or lack of network resources.

irRoutingAveragePathLength.name: irRoutingAveragePathLength
irRoutingAveragePathLength.description: The average length (in ports) of all paths generated since initialization.

tcsEntry.name: tcsEntry
tcsEntry.description: An entry in the tcs table ordered by slot. (1-n)

tcsIndex.name: tcsIndex
tcsIndex.description: Unique Index consisting of slot number.

tcsScsiVoltage.name: tcsScsiVoltage
tcsScsiVoltage.description: SCSI Voltage (or Bulk for switches) detected by TCS.

tcsPaddleTemp1.name: tcsPaddleTemp1
tcsPaddleTemp1.description: Paddle card temperature 1 detected by TCS.

tcsPaddleTemp2.name: tcsPaddleTemp2
tcsPaddleTemp2.description: Paddle card temperature 2 detected by TCS.

tcsPaddleWarnTemp1.name: tcsPaddleWarnTemp1
tcsPaddleWarnTemp1.description: Paddle card warning temperature 1 maintained by TCS.

tcsPaddleWarnTemp2.name: tcsPaddleWarnTemp2
tcsPaddleWarnTemp2.description: Paddle card warning temperature 2 maintained by TCS.

tcsPaddleShutdownTemp1.name: tcsPaddleShutdownTemp1
tcsPaddleShutdownTemp1.description: Warning temperature 1 at which the paddle card will shut down.

tcsPaddleShutdownTemp2.name: tcsPaddleShutdownTemp2
tcsPaddleShutdownTemp2.description: Warning temperature 2 at which the paddle card will shut down.

tcsShutdownTemp1.name: tcsShutdownTemp1
tcsShutdownTemp1.description: Warning temperature 2 at which the card will shut down.

tcsShutdownTemp2.name: tcsShutdownTemp2
tcsShutdownTemp2.description: Warning temperature 2 at which the card will shut down.

tcsFaultLight.name: tcsFaultLight
tcsFaultLight.description: The state of the fault light.

tcsReadyLight.name: tcsReadyLight
tcsReadyLight.description: The state of the ready light

tcsSwitchConnectivityMask.name: tcsSwitchConnectivityMask
tcsSwitchConnectivityMask.description: Bitmask of cards with which this function card communicates via the switch. Bit 0 is the least-significant bit. Bit 1 represents slot 1, bit 2 represents slot 2 and so on.

tcsPrimarySwitch.name: tcsPrimarySwitch
tcsPrimarySwitch.description: Primary Switch. When 'read' provides the current primary switch. When 'written' attempts to make the written value the new switch.

tcsSwitchFaultMaskA.name: tcsSwitchFaultMaskA
tcsSwitchFaultMaskA.description: Bitmask of slots reporting unhealthy clocks. If the corresponding bit is set, switch card A's clock is viewed as unhealthy by the function card in that slot. In addition, it indicates whether or not the entire switch card has been marked as usable or unusable. Bit 1 represents clock health for slot 1, bit 2 represents slot 2 and so on. Bit 0 is the least-significant bit. Bit 0 represents the dont-use bit for switch A. If bit 0 is set, it indicates that TCS has marked switch A as dont-use.

tcsSwitchFaultMaskB.name: tcsSwitchFaultMaskB
tcsSwitchFaultMaskB.description: Bitmask of slots reporting unhealthy clocks. If the corresponding bit is set, switch card B's clock is viewed as unhealthy by the function card in that slot. In addition, it indicates whether or not the entire switch card has been marked as usable or unusable. Bit 1 represents clock health for slot 1, bit 2 represents slot 2 and so on. Bit 0 is the least-significant bit. Bit 0 represents the dont-use bit for switch B. If bit 0 is set, it indicates that TCS has marked switch B as dont-use.

tcsSwitchCutoverSupport.name: tcsSwitchCutoverSupport
tcsSwitchCutoverSupport.description: willDoLossLess indicates that there are two SC2's that are in synch. wontDoLossLess indicates that there are two SC2's that are NOT in sync. cantDoLossLess indicates any other situation (1-SC1/SC2, 2-SC1's).

tcsFCPrimarySwitchA.name: tcsFCPrimarySwitchA
tcsFCPrimarySwitchA.description: The bit corresponding to that slot is a 1 if the card believes that Switch A is the primary switch and 0 otherwise. Bit 0 is the least-significant bit. Bit 1 represents slot 1, bit 2 represents slot 2 and so on.

tcsFCPrimarySwitchB.name: tcsFCPrimarySwitchB
tcsFCPrimarySwitchB.description: The bit corresponding to that slot is a 1 if the card believes that Switch B is the primary switch and 0 otherwise. Bit 0 is the least-significant bit. Bit 1 represents slot 1, bit 2 represents slot 2 and so on.

gidSoftwareVersionNumber.name: gidSoftwareVersionNumber
gidSoftwareVersionNumber.description: The global information distribution (GID) process software revision number

gidUpTime.name: gidUpTime
gidUpTime.description: The number of seconds the GID process has been running.

gidMemoryUse.name: gidMemoryUse
gidMemoryUse.description: The total amount of memory (in bytes) currently allocated by GID for all purposes.

gidTimersProcessed.name: gidTimersProcessed
gidTimersProcessed.description: The number of timers processed by the GID process since initialization.

gidMallocFailures.name: gidMallocFailures
gidMallocFailures.description: The number of times GID has failed to dynamically allocate memory since initialization.

gidDebugFlag.name: gidDebugFlag
gidDebugFlag.description: Bit mask for debug statements to AppLog. This is being used for debug purposes. It is not advised that the user change this. Future releases may move this to a debug subtree.

gidDebugLevel.name: gidDebugLevel
gidDebugLevel.description: The gidDebugLevel determines the amount of detail that the debug flags will cause to dump to the apps.log, where 0 means no detail and 3 is the maximum value Future releases may move this to a debug subtree.

gidAcceptedBcastRateIn.name: gidAcceptedBcastRateIn
gidAcceptedBcastRateIn.description: The LAN inbound broadcast traffic average inter-frame time specified in microseconds. The default rate is 20,000 microseconds. Defines the acceptable average inbound bcast rate. Future releases may move this to another subtree.

gidNbrCount.name: gidNbrCount
gidNbrCount.description: The number of neighbor NPs known to the GID process.

gidNbrTable.name: gidNbrTable
gidNbrTable.description: A table containing information about each GID neighbor.

gidNbrEntry.name: gidNbrEntry
gidNbrEntry.description: The information regarding a single GID neighbor.

gidNbrEIA.name: gidNbrEIA
gidNbrEIA.description: The internal address of the neighbor NP.

gidNbrVCI.name: gidNbrVCI
gidNbrVCI.description: The VCI of the reliable channel to the neighbor.

gidNbrSyncEvents.name: gidNbrSyncEvents
gidNbrSyncEvents.description: The number of synchronization protocol events associated with this neighbor that have occurred since initialization.

gidNbrDBReqListLength.name: gidNbrDBReqListLength
gidNbrDBReqListLength.description: The number of database requests queued to the neighbor.

gidNbrDBSumListLength.name: gidNbrDBSumListLength
gidNbrDBSumListLength.description: The number of database summary list entries queued for transmission to the neighbor.

gidNbrHellosRx.name: gidNbrHellosRx
gidNbrHellosRx.description: The number of Hello packets received from the neighbor.

gidNbrLinkAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrLinkAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrLinkAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of link state announcements received from the neighbor.

gidNbrNewLinkAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrNewLinkAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrNewLinkAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of link state announcements received from the neighbor and accepted as new.

gidNbrIPAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrIPAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrIPAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of internal IP address translation announcements received from the neighbor.

gidNbrNewIPAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrNewIPAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrNewIPAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of internal IP address translation announcements received from the neighbor and accepted as new.

gidNbrGenericAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrGenericAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrGenericAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of generic global information announcements received from the neighbor.

gidNbrNewGenericAnnouncementsRx.name: gidNbrNewGenericAnnouncementsRx
gidNbrNewGenericAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of generic global information announcements received from the neighbor and accepted as new.

gidClientCount.name: gidClientCount
gidClientCount.description: The number of registered GID client processes.

gidClientTable.name: gidClientTable
gidClientTable.description: A table containing information about each GID client process.

gidClientEntry.name: gidClientEntry
gidClientEntry.description: The information regarding a single GID client process.

gidClientEIA.name: gidClientEIA
gidClientEIA.description: The internal card address associated with the GID client process. Edge and trunk card control processes are associated with a unique card address. The NP card control process and the Congestion Avoidance information distribution process share the internal card address of the local NP.

gidClientAnnouncementsRx.name: gidClientAnnouncementsRx
gidClientAnnouncementsRx.description: The total number of global information announcements received from this GID client process since initialization.

gidClientLinkAnnouncementsRx.name: gidClientLinkAnnouncementsRx
gidClientLinkAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of link state information announcements received from this GID client process since initialization.

gidClientIPAnnouncementsRx.name: gidClientIPAnnouncementsRx
gidClientIPAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of internal IP address translation announcements received from this GID client process since initialization.

gidClientGenericAnnouncementsRx.name: gidClientGenericAnnouncementsRx
gidClientGenericAnnouncementsRx.description: The number of generic global information announcements received from this GID client process since initialization.

gidClientEventsTx.name: gidClientEventsTx
gidClientEventsTx.description: The number of global information-related events sent by the GID process to the GID client process since initialization.

gidClientPathsGenerated.name: gidClientPathsGenerated
gidClientPathsGenerated.description: The number of path generation requests made by the GID client process since initialization.

gidIONbrMsgBuffersFree.name: gidIONbrMsgBuffersFree
gidIONbrMsgBuffersFree.description: The number of neighbor message buffers available on the neighbor message buffer free list.

gidIONbrMsgBuffersActive.name: gidIONbrMsgBuffersActive
gidIONbrMsgBuffersActive.description: The number of neighbor message buffers currently active, either in transmission or queued for output.

gidIOClientMsgBuffersFree.name: gidIOClientMsgBuffersFree
gidIOClientMsgBuffersFree.description: The number of client message buffers available on the client message buffer free list.

gidIOClientMsgBuffersActive.name: gidIOClientMsgBuffersActive
gidIOClientMsgBuffersActive.description: The number of client message buffers currently active, either in transmission or queued for output.

gidSyncNbrsExistent.name: gidSyncNbrsExistent
gidSyncNbrsExistent.description: The number of neighbors in the Existent synchronization protocol state.

gidSyncNbrsExStart.name: gidSyncNbrsExStart
gidSyncNbrsExStart.description: The number of neighbors in the Exchange Start synchronization protocol state.

gidSyncNbrsExchange.name: gidSyncNbrsExchange
gidSyncNbrsExchange.description: The number of neighbors in the Exchange synchronization protocol state.

gidSyncNbrsLoading.name: gidSyncNbrsLoading
gidSyncNbrsLoading.description: The number of neighbors in the Loading synchronization protocol state.

gidSyncNbrsFull.name: gidSyncNbrsFull
gidSyncNbrsFull.description: The number of neighbors in the Full synchronization protocol state.

gidLinkDatabaseSize.name: gidLinkDatabaseSize
gidLinkDatabaseSize.description: The current size of the link state database, in bytes.

gidLineCardTable.name: gidLineCardTable
gidLineCardTable.description: A table containing information about each line card known to GID.

gidLineCardEntry.name: gidLineCardEntry
gidLineCardEntry.description: The information regarding a single line card.

gidLineCardChassis.name: gidLineCardChassis
gidLineCardChassis.description: The internal chassis ID of the chassis which contains the line card described by the link state entry.

gidLineCardSlot.name: gidLineCardSlot
gidLineCardSlot.description: The slot in the chassis which contains the line card described by the link state entry.

gidLineCardEntryAge.name: gidLineCardEntryAge

lightStreamBridgePortTable.name: lightStreamBridgePortTable
lightStreamBridgePortTable.description: Proprietary port parameters needed for LightStream node configuration. This table contains one entry for each bridge port.

lightStreamBridgePortEntry.description: Objects required for a given bridge port.

lightStreamBrPortPort.name: lightStreamBrPortPort

lightStreamBrPortDefaultAction.name: lightStreamBrPortDefaultAction
lightStreamBrPortDefaultAction.description: This is the action taken on frames received that do not match a defined filter.

lightStreamBrPortBcastRateLimit.name: lightStreamBrPortBcastRateLimit
lightStreamBrPortBcastRateLimit.description: Number of broadcast packets that this node forwards per second. The node discards all additional packets per second. If the value is zero, all broadcast packets are discarded. If the value is -1 all broadcast packets are forwarded. That is, there is no limit on broadcasts.

lightStreamBrPortDroppedBcastPkts.name: lightStreamBrPortDroppedBcastPkts
lightStreamBrPortDroppedBcastPkts.description: The number of broadcast packets dropped because the lightStreamBrPortBcastRateLimit was exceeded.

lightStreamBridgeFilterTable.name: lightStreamBridgeFilterTable
lightStreamBridgeFilterTable.description: A list of filters. Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) is being used here to provide the most flexibility in defining more complex filters in the future. Each filter is represented by a list of entries. Each entry is a single RPN token. To create an entry, create the list of tokens as follows: More than one token can be contained in a single message. All fields of a single token must be in the same message. The lightStreamBrFilterStatus object of all intermediate tokens must contain the value 'intermediateToken'. The lightStreamBrFilterStatus object of the last token must contain the value 'complete'. When the last token is created with a status of 'complete' the status field of every prior token associated with that filter is set to 'complete'. When the filter is set to 'complete', it is available for use in a lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterEntry. The filter is not actually used until its ID is placed in a lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterEntry and the associated parameters are defined. A filter may be used more than once in the lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable. The agent does not permit the user to 'delete' the filter entry until it is removed from the lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable. When a filter is placed into or removed from the lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable, its new state becomes active immediately. The agent provides timeout service for partially constructed filters. If a manager doesn't complete a filter definition within the timeout period (currently 3 minutes), the agent removes all tokens associated with that filter.

lightStreamBridgeFilterEntry.name: lightStreamBridgeFilterEntry
lightStreamBridgeFilterEntry.description: A single filter consists of multiple lightStreamBridgeFilterEntries. Each entry represents a single token of a given filter.

lightStreamBrFilterId.name: lightStreamBrFilterId
lightStreamBrFilterId.description: The ID assigned to this filter.

lightStreamBrFilterTokenIndex.name: lightStreamBrFilterTokenIndex
lightStreamBrFilterTokenIndex.description: The RPN index of this token within the filter. This value must be assigned sequentially starting with 1.

lightStreamBrFilterTokenType.name: lightStreamBrFilterTokenType
lightStreamBrFilterTokenType.description: This defines the type of token contained in this entry. There is no default value for this object, its value must be contained in the creation message.

lightStreamBrFilterTokenValue.name: lightStreamBrFilterTokenValue
lightStreamBrFilterTokenValue.description: The value for this token. The appropriate value depends on the lightStreamBrFilterTokenType. Because instances of this object can be of diverse types, they are exchanged as DisplayStrings and the agent parses it according to the type. If the type is 'operation', the agent expects one of the following character strings: maskAnd and or equal notEqual greater greaterOrEqual less lessOrEqual If the type is 'macAddrType' the agent expects a MAC address DisplayString in the format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx. If the type is 'frameField' the agent will expect of one of the following character strings: macSrc macDst macProto llcSSAP llcDSAP snapOUI snapProto For all other types, the agent expects a hex digit displayString in the form 0x800. This object has no default value. It must be explicitly set in the creation message.

lightStreamBrFilterStatus.name: lightStreamBrFilterStatus
lightStreamBrFilterStatus.description: To define an interim token, set this field to 'intermediateToken'. To define the final token set this field to 'complete'. This has the side-effect of setting the lightStreamBrFilterStatus fields of all tokens for this filter to 'complete'. To delete an unassigned filter, set this value to 'delete' in any of the filter's token entries. This has the side-effect of setting the lightStreamBrFilterStatus fields of all tokens for this filter to 'delete'. This object does not have a default value. To create an entry this object must be explicitly contained in the set message.

lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable.name: lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable
lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterTable.description: This table contains the list of assigned filters and the parameters associated with it. To add an entry to this table, all non-defaulted objects must be contained in a single message and the lightStreamBrFilterParmFilterId must already be created in the lightStreamBridgeFilterTable.

lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterEntry.name: lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterEntry
lightStreamBridgeFilterParameterEntry.description: The objects associated with a single assigned filter.

lightStreamBrFilterParmPort.name: lightStreamBrFilterParmPort
lightStreamBrFilterParmPort.description: The dot1dBasePort, defined in the standard Bridge MIB (RFC1286), this entry is defined for.

lightStreamBrFilterParmFilterPriority.name: lightStreamBrFilterParmFilterPriority
lightStreamBrFilterParmFilterPriority.description: The precedence assigned to this filter. The value 1 gives the object the highest priority on this port. It is recommended that these not be assigned sequentially. Sequential numbering would make it difficult to re-prioritize the filters.

lightStreamBrFilterParmAction.name: lightStreamBrFilterParmAction
lightStreamBrFilterParmAction.description: Definition of what action should be taken when a packet matching this filter is encountered.

lightStreamBrFilterParmMatchCounts.name: lightStreamBrFilterParmMatchCounts
lightStreamBrFilterParmMatchCounts.description: The number of times this filter instance was matched.

lightStreamBrFilterParmValidation.name: lightStreamBrFilterParmValidation
lightStreamBrFilterParmValidation.description: This object indicates whether the user has validated or invalidated this entry. This entry does not have a default value. To create an entry this object must be explicitly contained in the set message.

lightStreamBrStaticGoToCardSize.name: lightStreamBrStaticGoToCardSize
lightStreamBrStaticGoToCardSize.description: This object indicates how many bytes of the bit string dot1dStaticGoTo represent a single card. There must be enough bytes to represent all the ports on a card, and this is release specific. The dot1dStaticGoTo object is a bit string that represents the bridging ports on the LightStream Node.

lightStreamVliVersion.name: lightStreamVliVersion
lightStreamVliVersion.description: The version of VLI implemented in this node.

lightStreamVliPortCtlTable.name: lightStreamVliPortCtlTable
lightStreamVliPortCtlTable.description: This table contains the control information for port based VLI.

lightStreamVliPortCtlEntry.name: lightStreamVliPortCtlEntry
lightStreamVliPortCtlEntry.description: Information needed to manage port based VLI on a given bridge port.

lightStreamVliPortCtlPort.name: lightStreamVliPortCtlPort
lightStreamVliPortCtlPort.description: The bridge port this entry corresponds to. This value is the same as dot1dBasePort which is defined in the IETF standard Bridge MIB.

lightStreamVliPortCtlMode.name: lightStreamVliPortCtlMode
lightStreamVliPortCtlMode.description: This defines the type of control to be instrumented on this port. include: When this object is set to include, port based VLI will process only the work groups defined in the corresponding work group table entries. All other work groups will be filtered out on this port. exclude: When this object is set to exclude, port based VLI will process all work groups except those listed in the corresponding work group table entries. Those listed in the lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupTable will be filtered. The default state of exclude with an empty work group table allows all work groups to be recognized as valid on this port.

lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupTable.name: lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupTable
lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupTable.description: The list of work groups defined for port based VLI management.

lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupEntry.name: lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupEntry
lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupEntry.description: A work group to port association.

lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupPort.name: lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupPort
lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupPort.description: The port this work group is being defined on. This value is the same as dot1dBasePort.

lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupID.name: lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupID
lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupID.description: The identifier of the work group being assigned to this port. This must have a corresponding entry in the lightStreamVliWorkGroupTable.

lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupValidation.name: lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupValidation
lightStreamVliPortWorkGroupValidation.description: For conceptual row addition, this table requires all non-defaulted objects for a given entry to be contained in a single SNMP message. This object will not default. To create a new entry, this object must be explicitly set to valid. To remove an entry, this object must be explicitly set to invalid.
